thread.title: Bruce Springsteen fans arrive at airport to find Jetstar flight cancelled
thread.title_full: Bruce Springsteen fans arrive at airport to find Jetstar flight cancelled

author: Marty Sharpe
title: Bruce Springsteen fans arrive at airport to find Jetstar flight cancelled
text:
Bruce Springsteen fans arrive at airport to find Jetstar flight cancelled MARTY SHARPE Last updated 15:15, February 24 2017 REUTERS 
A cancelled Jetstar flight left some Hawke's Bay concert goers worried they may not get to see him perform in Auckland. 
Hawke's Bay Bruce Springsteen fans going to Auckland for his concert are irate that JetStar cancelled its 1.30pm flight out of Napier on Friday with little warning. 
Among those to have arrived at Napier airport on Friday ahead of the Saturday concert were Robyn and Mike Greatrex. 
Were you affected? Email SIMON HENDERY/FAIRFAX NZ 
Dancing in the dark. The Jetstar counter at Napier airport 
â€‹The couple were being taken to the airport by brother and sister and law Tony and Bev Wall when they got a text message from their daughter telling them the flight had been cancelled. 
READ MORE: 
Tony said their daughter had paid for their tickets, flights and accommodation and had just checked the JetStar website when she discovered the 1.30pm flight had been axed. JETSTAR/SUPPLIED 
Jetstar has been approached for comment on the cancellation. 
"We were there an hour before the flight was due to take off. They were just told it was cancelled without any explanation. They couldn't get another Jetstar flight because they're fully booked, and so were the Air New Zealand flights. 
"And there were no rental cars available because Hawke's Bay is so busy with the Matatini festival," Tony said. 
"There was a small crowd of very irate people there," he said. 
So the four returned home and Robyn and Mike have taken their own car to Auckland. Ad Feedback 
"They've been looking forward to this for months. They're huge Bruce fans and this was going to be a huge weekend for them, a huge holiday. They'd been looking forward to this," he said. 
"They've been told they'll get a refund for the flight up but not for the return flight on Sunday, which won't be much use as they'll have to drive back," he said. 
"It's hugely disappointing. Jetstar needs a rocket. They made a huge fuss when they started out of Napier in competition with Air New Zealand. Well Air New Zealand never behaved like this". 
Jetstar has been approached for comment. - Stuff
